page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY GREAT DUNMOW
page.content: The village gets it's name from the Saxon days when it was 'Dunemowe'which meant hill meadow.There was a Roman road through the village and Roman remains have been found under our school field,it has always been an agricultural area.At the time of the Domesday Book,Dunmow had 7 manors with a number of small houses and a population of 700.Today there is only 1 Manor and the population is 5,500.Church End like the High Street, is a conservation area.In earlier days it was separated from the town because the Causeway was a large marsh area which was impassable.All buildings along the Causeway except the Clock House were built after the 18th Century.Doctor's Pond can be found by The Downs,it got it's name because a doctor stocked the pond with fish.The first lifeboat was tested here in 1803
